Comment: Can you take the kid gloves off now guys? I see headlines every day that are far too sanguine for what's happening right now. Stop dancing around what's happening and state it for what it is.   It's not deportation without process, It's rendition.   It's not launching a cryptocurrency, it's money laundering and a bribery vehicle.   It's not "a strong stance on negotiations between Ukraine and Russia", it's aiding an enemy of the United States against an ally.   Stop giving Trump the benefit of the doubt. He's lost the right to not have malfeasance assumed around his actions and orders. If they look illegal and sketchy, say it straight. Call it out.

Comment: They won't take the kiddie gloves off until We the People stop quoting them.  I want to stop seeing "Constitutional Crisis" and instead see something like: "He has obstructed the Administration of Justice, by refusing his Assent to Laws for establishing Judiciary powers."   Maybe even something like: "He has refused his Assent to Laws, the most wholesome and necessary for the public good."  Shit, we could throw in: "He has endeavoured to prevent the population of these States; for that purpose obstructing the Laws for Naturalization of Foreigners; refusing to pass others to encourage their migrations hither, and raising the conditions of new Appropriations of Lands."  I kinda like: "For cutting off our Trade with all parts of the world"  Here's a classic: "For transporting us beyond Seas to be tried for pretended offences"  Remember that time Trump claimed Birthright Citizenship isn't a thing, before he acted on it with all those children: "He has abdicated Government here, by declaring us out of his Protection and waging War against us."  Not quite the full quote: "He has excited domestic insurrections amongst us"
